meanings.definition: In a touchy or irritable manner.
meanings.sent1: She responded tetchily when asked about her grades.
meanings.sent2: He spoke tetchily to the customer service representative.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed tetchily when its tail was accidentally stepped on.
meanings.sent4: The old door creaked tetchily in the quiet house.
meanings.sent5: The teacher looked tetchily at the students misbehaving in class.

meanings.sent1: Her tetchily expression made it clear she was not in the mood to chat.
meanings.sent2: The tetchily boss scolded his employees for being late.
meanings.sent3: The tetchily squirrel chattered at anyone who came near its tree.
meanings.sent4: The tetchily sky seemed to mirror his foul mood.
meanings.sent5: The tetchily dog growled at the mailman approaching the house.
